ext_descriptions.ext_description: A material_designation is a label identifying the association of a product with either a material property value and, or the material composition of the product.
the word or group of words by which the material_designation is referred to.
the definition of the product or parts of the product for which the material_designation is specified.

A material_designation_characterization is the characterization of a material designation through its association with either a
or a .
the word or group of words by which the material_designation_characterization is referred to.
a narrative description of the material_designation_characterization.
the definition of the material designation for which the material_designation_characterization is specified.
the definition of the property for which the material_designation_characterization is specified.

A material_property is a type of
which shall have conditions that determine its validity when it specifies a property of a , , or .

The name of each
that is related to a single
or
(through their definition attribute) shall be unique within the collection of
entities which are related through that
or .

If a
is not to be assigned to a
through its
attribute , all of the
that reference it shall also be material_property_representations and will therefore have associated data_environments.

ext_description.p:
A product_material_composition_relationship is a type of . The product_material_composition_relationship associates a material constituent with a product. The product participates in a
as a . The constituent participates in a
as a .
ext_description.note: The spatial location and orientation of the material constituents in the product are specified by their . By this means the material structure of the product is described.

ext_description.p: the name or identifier for the kind of relationship between a constituent and a product.
ext_description.example: Possible values of a class include: 'mixture', 'chemically bonded', and 'alloyed'.

ext_description.p: the quantity of the material constituent in a product and the units in which the quantity is expressed.
ext_description.note: Examples of elements of the set could be: minimum value, maximum value, typical value. The description of the values as maximum, minimum or typical may be achieved by using the constructs in the .

ext_description.p: the basis on which a product is decomposed into its constituents.
ext_description.example: Expected values for composition basis include: 'volume', 'weight', 'moles', and 'atoms'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: a description of the procedure by which the constituent amount is determined.

ext_description.p: A property_definition_relationship is an association between two property_definitions. The meaning of the relationship for a particular context is defined in specialisations of this resource construct.
ext_description.note: Relationships captured using this entity may be parent-to-child relationships. Specialisations of this entity state this fact if it is true for the particular specialisation.

This entity, in conjunction with the
entity is based on the relationship template that is described in Annex D of ISO 10303-41.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the word or group of words by which the property definition relationship is referred to.
text that relates the nature of the property definition relationship.
one of the property_definitions which is a part of the relationship.

the other
which is part of the relationship.

ext_description.p:
The acyclic_property_definition_relationship function determines whether or not the given property definitions have been self-defined by the associations made in the specified . This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
ext_description.note:
A specified type of the
entity is either a
or one of its subtypes. The function returns a value of TRUE is none of the elements of the relatives argument occur in the relation argument which is given in the specific_relation argument. Otherwise it returns a value of FALSE.

This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other parts of ISO 10303 that use the
entity define rules that use this function.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
(input) the candidate
that is to be checked.

(input) the set of property_definitions which the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.
